Text.Value: We should have a chat, you and I. But not here.
Walk away while you still have legs to walk with.
Pretty words. If you want to threaten me, don't disguise it.
Must be the surroundings. Rather bleak and lonesome. One feels so... exposed.
Am I talking to the mouse or the cat?
Neither. The fox, rather, hiding in a word: a silent observer - about to break the silence.
Come.

EditorData.SFXTags: Teleportation sound FX - same as FOR_Monitor_BridgeEncounter

Text.Value: I'm Karlach. And somehow I don't think you're at my service at all.
Pleasure. I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].
They do know how to write them in Cormyr, don't they?
Shall we withdraw? We have much to discuss... to our mutual satisfaction.
My, my, what manner of place is this? A path to redemption, or a road to damnation? Hard to say, for your journey is just beginning.
The mouse smiled brightly: it outfoxed the cat!
You weren't invited here. Explain yourself.
This dark little tableau is decidedly too gloomy and middle-of-nowhere for my tastes.
It's not every day one meets such a cavalier sinner as yourself. A true, bloody pleasure.
Well met. I am Raphael. Very much at your service.
Why, I never! You're paranoid, aren't you?
I'm rather the admirer of the sanguine arts, even if I wasn't quite born under a killing moon myself.
What would suit the occasion? The words to a lullaby, perhaps?
This quaint little scene is decidedly too middle-of-nowhere for my tastes.
Don't tell me you're from my old staff. One evil butler is enough.
Of course, what I have to say merits some privacy - as well as some more... let's call it refinement.
Bah! It looks like a duergar, but it speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like a drow, but it speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like a githyanki, but it speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like a deep gnome, but it speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like a gnome, but it speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like a dragonborn, but speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like a half-orc, but speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like a dwarf, but it speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like an elf, but it speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like a halfling, but it speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like a human, but it speaks like a beast.
Bah! It looks like a tiefling, but it speaks like a beast.
Bah! Such a rare breed, but with such a common tongue.
Bah! A beast you are indeed.
Most would quail to find themselves in a place so grim and unforgiving, but your journey has no bright paths. Only dead ends, and ruinous roads.
Then down came the claw, and that, love, was that.
Charmed, I'm sure. In more ways than one...
Oh, you're familiar with my work?
My, my, what a curious meeting place this is. Only those in search of something altogether out of this world would scour this forgotten road.
You wound my honour! Consider me a peer for your vice.
Karlach. Why does that name ring a bell? Hmm. Perhaps I read it in a book somewhere.

EditorData.NodeContext: He knows exactly who she is and is playing coy.

Synopsis: A devil named Raphael appears to lightly taunt the player, then whisks them off to the House of Hope (FOR_MonitorDinner).
